alert.note: Alert for Coffee (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 27 at 11:56AM CDT until April 01 at 9:35AM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Alabama, including the following counties, Coffee and Dale. * WHEN...Until 200 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1156 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen in the last 1 Hour. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Daleville, Enterprise, Fort Rucker, Ozark, Level Plains, Newton, New Brockton, Lowe Army Heliport, Gerald, Coppinville, Shell Army Field, Keyton, Hooper Stage Field, Knox Field, Enterprise Municipal A/P, Hanchey Field, Kelly, Battens Crossroads, Dean Church Road and Central City. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
